grade6-alexander-great.name: Alexander the Great
grade6-alexander-great.description: Explore Alexander the Great's conquests, empire building, spread of Hellenism, and the impact individuals can have on history

grade6-stone-age.name: Life in the Stone Age
grade6-stone-age.description: Compare and contrast life in the Old Stone Age (Paleolithic) and New Stone Age (Neolithic), understanding the transition from hunters and gatherers to farmers and settlers

grade6-charlemagne.name: Charlemagne and the Frankish Empire
grade6-charlemagne.description: The rise of the Frankish kingdom, Charlemagne's coronation as Emperor, and the synthesis of Germanic, Christian, and Roman traditions that shaped medieval Europe

grade6-ancient-egypt.name: Ancient Egypt and the Nile
grade6-ancient-egypt.description: Ancient Egypt as an early civilization - the Nile's geographic significance, pharaonic rule, pyramids, society, and religion

grade6-athenian-democracy.name: Athenian Democracy
grade6-athenian-democracy.description: Explores the development of Athenian democracy from Solon's reforms through Pericles' Golden Age and the constitutional foundations of ancient democratic governance

grade6-greek-culture.name: Greek Culture & Legacy
grade6-greek-culture.description: Explore Greek cultural achievements including mythology, epic poetry, the Olympic Games, theater traditions, and the impact of the Persian Wars on Greek identity

grade6-greek-polis.name: The Greek Polis
grade6-greek-polis.description: Greek city-states, influence of landscape on political development, and Greek colonization around the Mediterranean

grade6-historical-sources.name: Historical Sources and Archaeological Methods
grade6-historical-sources.description: Identify and analyze different types of historical sources and understand how archaeologists study the past

grade6-roman-republic.name: The Roman Republic
grade6-roman-republic.description: Exploring Rome's mythical founding, the structure of the Republic including the Senate and social classes, and the transition from Republic to imperial rule

grade6-roman-empire.name: The Roman Empire
grade6-roman-empire.description: Augustus and the Pax Romana, life in Roman provinces, the Limes frontier system, and Romanization throughout the empire

grade6-judaism-christianity.name: Judaism and Early Christianity
grade6-judaism-christianity.description: Judaism in the Roman Empire including diaspora and temple destruction, and Christianity's development from persecuted minority to state religion

grade6-fall-of-rome.name: Fall of Rome and Migration Period
grade6-fall-of-rome.description: Decline and fall of the Roman Empire, the Migration Period (Völkerwanderung), and the Mediterranean tripartition

grade7-age-of-discovery.name: Gutenberg and the Age of Discovery
grade7-age-of-discovery.description: Explores the invention of the printing press and European exploration of the Americas in the late 15th century

grade7-crusades.name: The Crusades
grade7-crusades.description: Explore the Crusades as a period of religious conflict, military campaigns, and cultural exchange between Christian Europe and the Islamic world, including the fall of Constantinople

grade7-investiture-controversy.name: Church vs. State - The Investiture Controversy
grade7-investiture-controversy.description: Understand the power struggle between medieval popes and emperors over the right to appoint bishops and the resulting conflict that shaped church-state relations

grade7-medieval-cities.name: Medieval Cities and Trade
grade7-medieval-cities.description: Medieval urban development, city rights, the Hanseatic League, trade networks, and the emergence of the Bürger class

grade7-monastic-life.name: Monastic Life
grade7-monastic-life.description: Explore medieval monasteries as religious communities, cultural centers, and centers of learning

grade7-absolutism.name: Absolutism and Louis XIV
grade7-absolutism.description: French absolutism under Louis XIV, Versailles as a symbol of power, government structures of absolute monarchy, and the balance of power in early modern Europe

grade7-medieval-kingship.name: Medieval Kingship and Feudalism
grade7-medieval-kingship.description: Understand medieval rulership structures, the feudal system, and the development of the Holy Roman Empire under Otto I

grade7-baroque.name: Baroque Art and Architecture
grade7-baroque.description: Baroque art and architecture as cultural and political expression, buildings as symbols of power from Greek theater to modern government buildings, and the connection between artistic style and political ideology

grade7-renaissance.name: Renaissance and Humanism
grade7-renaissance.description: Explore the Renaissance period as a cultural rebirth featuring human-centered thinking, artistic innovation, and a new worldview that transformed European society

grade7-reformation.name: The Reformation
grade7-reformation.description: Martin Luther's 95 Theses (1517), the religious split between Catholics and Protestants, the Peasants' War, and witch persecution in 16th-century Europe

grade7-thirty-years-war.name: Thirty Years' War
grade7-thirty-years-war.description: Understand the causes, course, devastation, and consequences of the Thirty Years' War (1618-1648) and the Peace of Westphalia

grade7-medieval-society.name: Medieval Social Order
grade7-medieval-society.description: Understand the medieval three-estate system (clergy, nobility, peasants), the manorial system (Grundherrschaft), and daily life across social classes
